description:
Flax seeds are a good source of many important nutrients, including protein, fiber, omega-3 fatty acids, thiamine, and copper. flax seeds have milt, nutty and crispy flavor. flaxseed is a versatile ingredient that can enhance the taste and texture of almost any recipe, you can use flaxseeds in a morning smoothie, homemade burgers, and many more dishes. 

Flaxseeds help improve your cholesterol level and also have several other benefits like reducing blood pressure, weight management and many more, let's quickly go through its benefits:

details.full_description: Flaxseeds are of two types, brown and golden both are equally nutritious and loaded with nutrients. It contains protein, fiber, Omega-3 fatty acids, thiamine, and copper, also contains manganese and magnesium in good quantity in one tablespoon.

Flaxseed contains two types of fiber, soluble and insoluble which helps in promoting gut health and improves bowel regularity.  Flaxseeds contain a good amount of fiber per seed which helps in improving the digestive system.

Flaxseeds are rich in ALA(alpha-linolenic acid), a type of omega-3 fatty acid that plays are crucial role in improving heart health, research shows that ALA helps in reducing inflammation and lower risk of heart disease, and reduce chances of stroke.
Flaxseed is renowned for its ability to reduce blood pressure levels, research has shown that taking flaxseeds regularly for 3 months may lower your blood pressure.
Studies show that flaxseed may aid in weight management, flaxseed may help you feel full for longer due to the richness of fiber, which leads to reducing hunger which may support weight management.
Flaxseed is loaded with nutrients, this tiny seed may improve digestive health, protect against certain cancer, manage blood sugar levels, and lower blood pressure and cholesterol level.

title: Health benefits of flaxseed
